intro: Manglilla dentata, commonly known as the serrated manglilla, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Manglilla dentata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks.
